4 Performing Taxonomically Informed Metabolite Annotation

Adriano Rutz

2023-01-17

Source: vignettes/IV-processing.Rmd
IV-processing.Rmd

This vignette describes how to perform Taxonomically Informed Metabolite Annotation. If you followed all previous steps successfully, this should be a piece of cake, you deserve it!

library("timaR")

Before running the corresponding code, do not forget to modify config/params/process_annotations.yaml.

source(file = "inst/scripts/process_annotations.R")
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:37 This script performs taxonomically informed scoring preceded by MS1 annotation and followed by chemical consistency informed scoring 
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:37 Authors:  AR , PMA 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:37 Contributors: ... 
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:37 Loading paths 
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:37 Loading yaml parameters 
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:37 Loading command line arguments 
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:37 ... files ... 
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:37 ... annotations 
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:37 ... metadata_table_biological_annotation 
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:37 ... edges table 
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:37 ... structure-organism pairs table 
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:56 ... single charge adducts table 
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:56 ... adducts masses for in source dimers and multicharged 
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:56 ... neutral lossses 
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:56 ... exact masses for MS1 annotation 
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:57 performing MS1 annotation 
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:57 filtering desired adducts and adding mz tolerance 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:58 setting to data.table format for faster performance 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:58 adding rt tolerance ... 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:58 ... on the other side (without tolerance) 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:58 setting joining keys 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:58 joining within given rt tolerance 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:59 adding delta mz tolerance for single charge adducts 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:59 calculating delta mz for single charge adducts 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:59 setting joining keys 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:59 neutral losses 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:59 setting joining keys 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:59 joining within given delta mz tolerance (neutral losses) 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:59 joining within given delta mz tolerance (adducts) 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:59 keeping initial and destination feature 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:59 joining with initial results (adducts) 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:59 joining with initial results (neutral losses) 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:59 setting joining keys 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:02:59 joining within given mz tolerance and filtering possible single charge adducts only 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:04 cleaning results 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:04 keeping unique adducts per exact mass 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:05 joining exact masses with single charge adducts 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:07 adding adduct mass to get back to [M] 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:07 keeping these ions for dimers and multicharged exploration starting from [M] 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:07 calculating multicharged and in source dimers and adding delta mz tolerance 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:08 setting joining keys 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:08 joining within given rt tolerance 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:11 setting joining keys 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:14 setting joining keys 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:14 joining within given mz tolerance and filtering possible multicharge / dimeric adducts 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:18 formatting initial results 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:18 joining MS2 results, single adducts, neutral losses, and multicharged / dimers and ranking 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:19 adding "notAnnotated" 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:21 MS1 annotation led to 
#>  1835918 annotations , on 
#>  7897 features , of which 
#>  7876 were not previously annotated. 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:24 adding biological organism metadata 
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:25 performing taxonomically informed scoring 
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:25 normalizing initial score 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:26 selecting DB columns 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:26 keeping distinct candidates per taxonomical rank 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:28 calculating biological scores ... 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:28 ... domain 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:29 ... kingdom 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:33 ... phylum 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:36 ... class 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:40 ... order 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:44 ... family 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:48 ... tribe 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:49 ... genus 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:53 ... species 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:59 ... varietas 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:03:59 keeping best biological score only 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:09 joining with initial results 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:15 adding "notClassified" 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:17 taxonomically informed scoring led to 
#>  1267278 annotations reranked at the kingdom level, 
#>  1254756 annotations reranked at the phylum level, 
#>  969542 annotations reranked at the class level, 
#>  155793 annotations reranked at the order level, 
#>  127517 annotations reranked at the family level, 
#>  13861 annotations reranked at the genus level, 
#>  3895 annotations reranked at the species level, 
#>  and 0 annotations reranked at the variety level. 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:21 cleaning taxonomically informed results and preparing for chemically informed scoring 
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:21 keeping only MS1 candidates with minimum 
#>  0.5  biological score 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:21 erasing other MS1 candidates 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:24 adding "notAnnotated" 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:24 adding "notClassified" 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:24 keeping clusters with at least 3 features  
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:24 keeping clusters with less than 3 features 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:25 calculating chemical consistency features with at least 2 neighbors ... 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:25 ... among edges ... 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:25 ... at the pathway level 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:26 ... at the superclass level 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:27 ... at the class level 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:29 joining all except -1 together 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:29 adding dummy consistency for features with less than 2 neighbors 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:29 binding results together 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:29 performing chemically informed scoring 
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:29 calculating chemical score ... 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:29 ... adding metadata 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:30 ... pathway 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:31 ... superclass 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:31 ... class 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:31 ... outputting best score 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:31 ... joining 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:32 ... cleaning 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:38 chemically informed scoring led to 
#>  31361 annotations reranked at the pathway level, 
#>  20879 annotations reranked at the superclass level, and 
#>  4981 annotations reranked at the class level. 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:39 cleaning for cytoscape export 
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:39 filtering top  3  candidates and keeping only MS1 candidates with minimum 
#>  0.5  biological score or 
#>  0.666 chemical score 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:40 adding initial metadata (RT, etc.) and simplifying columns 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:50 adding structures metadata 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:50 selecting columns for cytoscape output 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:04:51 summarizing results 
#>  
#> 2023-01-17 11:05:06 Exporting ... 
#> 2023-01-17 11:05:06 ... path to used parameters is data/processed/230117_110506 
#> 2023-01-17 11:05:06 ... path to export is data/processed/230117_110506/FinalResults.tsv 
#> 2023-01-17 11:05:06 Script finished in 2.489243 mins

The final exported file is formatted in order to be easily imported in Cytoscape to further explore your data!

We hope you enjoyed using TIMA and are pleased to hear from you!

For any remark or suggestion, please fill an issue or feel free to contact us directly.
